channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CO
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CO

item.title: Report X-2024031330
item.description:
Report X-2024031330

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-21
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Thin plastic jugs in doublewall heavy corrugated carton with integrated jug stabilizers. Two jugs developed cracks roughly two inches long on sides near base and spilled contents, soiling other jugs and damaging carton. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking package discovered during sortation. Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA. DescribePack: Plastic bottles in corrugated inner and outer cartons. Loose cap on one bottle allowed leakage which soiled same jug and damaged outer and two of four inner cartons. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined hazmat tote and sent to QA.

item.title: Report X-2024031264
item.description:
Report X-2024031264

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-20
  • City: BROOMFIELD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At 7:20pm, during outbound a van line manager reported to QA that van on WA 335 had strong odor. While walking to the van, I noticed a leaking hazmat on the tugger cart next to the IC rollers on vanline 3. This hazmat was wet on the bottom and top corners and was placed next to other hazmats from the same shipper by package handler. I placed hazmat in plastic bag/red tote and took it to QA1. I also inspected van and tugger cart for spills which I could not find. Finally, I informed van line managers of what I discovered. DescribePack: The large main cap leaked because it is loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a plastic bag and bin.

item.title: Report X-2024031211
item.description:
Report X-2024031211

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was taken to the load side after being unloaded form P&D vehicle. Package was then dropped and brought to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Body of drum is dented near cap about five inches wide and nearly an inch deep. This caused the lid to separate from the drum and contents to leak out. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was brought to QA, orientation arrows were not observed causing more contents to leak than was necessary.

item.title: Report X-2024031201
item.description:
Report X-2024031201

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: AURORA
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damage was discovered in the unload. The unload manager called upon an Admin for assistance in containing the spill. DescribePack: One of the four total bottles leaked contents due to a loose lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The responding Admin contained the shipment in a hazardous materials spill tote and transported it to the hazmat cage for processing.
